title: "Cannot Relate Bound Region" causing panic at Box<dyn Any> in Compiler
body:
<!--
Thank you for filing a bug report! 🐛 Please provide a short summary of the bug,
along with any information you feel relevant to replicating the bug.
-->

I tried running `cargo build` on this commit: https://github.com/SamuelSchlesinger/valheim-damage/commit/1d3efd0bc33261e945e833d11514b101ad958c34 
As there is a `rust-toolchain` file in there, this is on the nightly.

I expected to see this happen: Code builds or I get a reasonable compiler error. I get a reasonable compiler error on the stable branch.

Instead, this happened: 

```
error: internal compiler error: compiler/rustc_infer/src/infer/region_constraints/mod.rs:568:17: cannot relate bound region: ReLateBound(DebruijnIndex(0), BoundRegion { var: 0, kind: BrNamed(DefId(30:611 ~ plotters[d9f2]::chart::context::{impl#1}::draw_series::'b), 'b) }) <= '_#59r

thread 'rustc' panicked at 'Box<dyn Any>', /rustc/015a824f2dffe32707fceb59c47effaf7b73486c/compiler/rustc_errors/src/lib.rs:1393:9
stack backtrace:
   0:     0x7f24f5c6d820 - std::backtrace_rs::backtrace::libunwind::trace::h7bdac8deb0a70b12
                               at /rustc/015a824f2dffe32707fceb59c47effaf7b73486c/library/std/src/../../backtrace/src/backtrace/mod.rs:66:5

                               at /rustc/015a824f2dffe32707fceb59c47effaf7b73486c/library/core/src/fmt/mod.rs:1202:17

note: the compiler unexpectedly panicked. this is a bug.

note: we would appreciate a bug report: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/new?labels=C-bug%2C+I-ICE%2C+T-compiler&template=ice.md

note: rustc 1.65.0-nightly (015a824f2 2022-08-22) running on x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

note: compiler flags: --crate-type bin -C embed-bitcode=no -C debuginfo=2 -C incremental

note: some of the compiler flags provided by cargo are hidden

query stack during panic:
#0 [typeck] type-checking `main`
#1 [typeck_item_bodies] type-checking all item bodies
#2 [analysis] running analysis passes on this crate
end of query stack
error: could not compile `damage`
```

Comment: Fun to see there is DeBruijn indexing going on, but I'm sure I'm not supposed to know that from simply using the compiler.
